website_summaries.verdict: Simple hiking shoe design includes breathable mesh throughout and sturdy sole quality.
pros: Multiple color options aren't too gaudy
Comfortable to wear for long days, as mesh allows air flow
Includes extra padding around the shoe's sole to ensure protection for the foot when worn in harsh terrain
cons: May not last long for heavy-duty users

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love These
customer_reviews.text: I can't stress enough how awesome these shoes are. I drive a big brown truck (with a matching uniform) delivering mess all day. I'm walking anywhere from 5-12 miles a day for 8-14 hours. I started wearing these for their weight (lack thereof) and bc I hate boots. I've worn vibram toe shoes sprinting and while working out so my feet are used to being in a barefoot state for some time. Walking around all day, no matter my environment or weather, I have really enjoyed wearing these Glove 4s! Even if they do tend to hold a strong odor, yet somehow dry very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Colby H.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I would have loved to leave a 5 star review, sadly, this is not the case. The shoes were beautiful, but they were possibly smooshed a little - the right one had a kink in the elastic that dug into my foot and left a line. I'm a disabled veteran with a spinal cord injury which has left me with very limited feeling in my feet, so any skin issues can become enormous medical problems. It's the whole reason why I ordered these wide shoes. I would like the same model shoe again. I returned them, but I would hate to go through the return process to find another defect.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Wynacht

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after 2 months!!!
customer_reviews.text: So, I would like to say first that I really liked the shoes! They fit well, are lightweight and are comfortable! However, I only use these shoes for running stairs and light jogs and only 2 months after using them they tore a little bit right above the Vibrant logo! I know it's a small tare but it'll just get bigger with use.. I'm very disappointed at the quality, especially for the price, I would not likely buy Merrell shoes again
customer_reviews.author: Ni

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers/shoes are constructed with an aggressively high and hard arch support, that actually hurts when walking around. Within 1 minute of testing them by walking around my apartment with them, I knew I would have to return them. This is a shame, I have an 8 year old frayed pair of Merrell "glove" sneakers, the most comfortable I have ever owned, should have bought 2-3 extra pairs at the time, the model is no longer made, should have anticipated this. "Progress" and innovation are not always good.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good workout shoes, not fit for some trails.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are light weight and comfortable, however not suitable for all trails. The sole is very thin and gives good flexibility, but if you step on a root, stone, or a large piece of gravel it hurts sometimes. They did a much better job handling the asphalt running track than the great outdoors. Even walking on gravel can be uncomfortable at times. Otherwise these shoes are great for lifting, treadmill, and running on smooth terrain.
customer_reviews.author: cmk

customer_reviews.title: No as Wide toed as Vivobarefoots and Vibram Five Fingers
customer_reviews.text: These are decent shoes, but what I was looking for shoes that can "make you feel the earth". They don't elevate the heels, there is no gel or cushioning to block the censors, and it has no arch or heel support which is one of the things you would look for in "Barefoot Shoes". But it felt like my toes were a little squished when I ordered them my size (US 9.5-10). I bought them in US 9.5. I was expecting them to be a little wider. The entire Trail Glove Series will make you feel like you are wearing a compressor on your foot. I good barefoot shoe should be wide, not just longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Tested out on my treadmill and still breaking them in but they are very comfortable so far. For running they promote correct form (i.e. not heel-striking). I also really like the flexible laces. Only downside is the toe box is a bit long and wide. Some extra room is recommended for running but these are much bigger than expected. I bought size 12. In regular shoes I wear a 12 E and these fit more like a 12.5 EE. If I buy another pair I will probably buy a 1/2 size smaller. It's not so big that the toe of the shoe curls up on me when walking/running but you definitely notice the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Lives Up To The Hype (UPDATED after two months of wear.)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe based on the favorable customer reviews and am not disappointed. The Trail Glove 4 is very comfortable for walking and moderate exercise. UPDATE: After two months of wear the material on the inside of both toes are beginning to tear. I've seen a few other reports of this very same defect too. It's too bad because I love these shoes but the quality definitely isn't equal to the price. Merrell needs to work on their durability.
customer_reviews.author: EVW

customer_reviews.title: High arch good tread
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking they would be more of a barefoot fit due to the product description. I have a low arch, not flat footed though, and the arch support on these was way, way too much. I wore them around the house for a couple of days to see if I would get used to them. Not so much. I really wanted to like them. The sole design and tread are amazing. But the arch support is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonimus Prime

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Less than 8 months in, with minimal usage and they are falling apart. Only used about twice a week
customer_reviews.author: Shaka

customer_reviews.title: I want to love them
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few pairs of Merrell's athletic shoes in the past and they all have the same issue: the edge along the inner arch of the shoe causes pain. Where the sole meets the upper of the shoe there is a rubbery ridge that always seems to dig into the arch of my foot, causing extremely painful blisters. I realize this is really dependent on your arches, but for me it's excruciating. I tried these on, took a few steps and immediately knew I would have the same problem with these that I have with my past Merrells. It's unfortunate because they're so comfortable otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D. Mccracken

customer_reviews.title: First time buying Merrells, pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I hardly even went hard in this shoe, gym mostly and its worn defined lines across the tops like the material isnt flexible and is weakening every time the shoe bends. Never seen anything like it but I've only had these for like 5 months and I'm pretty dissatisfied. If it weren't for the material wearing down and turning white about to tear I'd prolly get these again, however I've gone back to Newbalance Minimus 10v1 because my first pair of those endured about 5 years of trail running, bouldering and crushing the gym. The vibram sole is most of the appeal here anyways which will easily outlast the rest of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are definitely off by a half size so do order a half size up from your normal well fitting shoe. Having said that these shoes are so comfortable they wrap around my feet like a glove. I like the extra tread that these have over other Merrell barefoot shoes they feel more substantial when walking around work. I have received several compliments about them from random people and have recommended them to many. The only down side I have noticed with these is that the tops are not water resistant at all and when out in the rain your feet will assuredly get wet. Other than that these are excellent shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: A Keepeer
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these shoes on a short hilly hike several times and it think they are fantastic. I rotate them with a more conventional hiking shoe from Oboz and that is working for me. No breaking in with the Merrell, great right out of the box. My hiking course has a lot of roots and irregularities and that hasn't been an issue. My foot is slightly on the narrow side of medium and the fit is perfect. And I think it would be to if my foot was slightly narrower or wider. It's possible that someone with a wide foot might not enjoy the same fit.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw in otherwise good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had 5 pairs of the model 3 (love them) decide ti try model 4. Good shoe, but one big design flaw: there is an elastic band on the outside edge of the shoe (inside) that quickly rubs/bends against the outside of the foot (see photo). After all day wearing it hurts! I have to dig my finger in there twice a day to flatten it out. :(
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K. Putnam

customer_reviews.title: I Can Haz Shooez? or How I learned I have a problem...
customer_reviews.text: I liked them so much I bought them thrice. Picked up the red pair first on sale and really liked them, and slowly expanded the collection after reading hit and miss things about the TrailGlove 5 (compared to the TG4). I'll admit, I'm not really the target demographic since I'm not a runner, and don't get out much. But I really like shoes that feel like you aren't wearing anything. I don't like just standing around in them, but walking around for work (usually 7-10k steps daily) these things are great. Now, back to trying to find the other colors ...
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great Minimalist Trail Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Merrell minimalist trail running shoes for 4 years - probably averaging a pair every year after wearing either the sole down or tearing the sides - and this Trail Glove Runner is another great iteration. I was pleasantly surprised by how the tongue was replaced by simply wrapping the inner wall of the shoe over the top, such that there is only a slit opening near the outer wall. Visually, it makes the shoes look streamline (while making it still look like a normal shoe by preserving the normal lacing). Functionally, it fells even smoother on the inside (which is more comfortable).
customer_reviews.author: Allan Lee Chan

customer_reviews.title: Not barefoot or glove-like at all.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are marketed as barefoot shoes. They have no drop-height. They have a rigid sole which is fitted to provide arch support. This makes for a very aesthetically pleasing shoe. However, it also makes the shoe very uncomfortable if your foot is not that shape. After wearing it for a few days the soles jab into the arches of my feet. I find this extremely unpleasant. I would recommend looking elsewhere or trying these on in a store first if you are used to barefoot shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Mender

customer_reviews.title: One of the best trail running/zero drop shoes I've tried. Good still be better though
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good shoe. Fit is snug around the main foot, but fairly open in the toebox. The size I got seems to conform to the same size in other shoes (didn't need to get 1/2 size up or down). Only issue I have with it is the arch support. It is pretty pronounced and stiff. My archs start to ache a little if standing for running for long hours, especially if on hard terrain or floors. Would be nice if the support was more soft and flexible. Or at least not so pronounced, maybe a little flatter would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great Outdoor Shoe
customer_reviews.text: First pair of Merrell shoes. I primarily use them for mountain and road biking. Occasionally I have to walk parts of bike trails. These shoes have been great so far. Very comfortable, no blisters or break in issues. I’ve got wide feet and they fit just fine. Only issue I’ve got is some of the side material of the arch isn’t covered by the vibram sole because it’s rather narrow in the part so that material is getting chewed up faster than I’d like. Part of that also is caused by my bike pedals and these aren’t made for clawed bike pedals. All in all still a great shoe. I’ll definitely get another pair when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Travis B.

customer_reviews.title: love these
customer_reviews.text: been running in this shoe for a few years. in fact, i wear this shoe everywhere; i don't even wear any sneakers anymore, and i have a lot of sneakers. i recently tried the trail glove 5, and the 4s are preferred. the trail glove 5 arch support was actually a welcome addition for me, since i have an arch in my foot, but for some reason, the tongue on the right foot started rubbing against my toes and caused a lot of discomfort during my treadmill run. for that reason, i'll be sticking with the 4s.
customer_reviews.author: Monergist

customer_reviews.title: Super Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've used many models of the Morrell shoes, the trail glove 4 seems to be the best. It seems to be better constructed, and he better design with the wrap-around tongue and a better more protective soul that is still flexible and you can still feel through, and it has better grip. They fit true to size right out of the box with no sock. They're very comfortable did a 7 mile run right out of the box part trail part asphalt no blisters no hotspots and no bruises. I immediately ordered another pair. It appears they will last much longer than either of my 2 and 3 model shoes, but only miles will tell.
customer_reviews.author: bodyworks2010

customer_reviews.title: Feel Great and Look Good, but Questionable Quality
customer_reviews.text: I wear an 11M and they fit me like a glove right out of the box. My feet run slightly narrow and so do the shoes so keep that in mind when you order. I highly recommend checking around locally for stores that sell them and trying on a pair to see if you need to order half a size up or not. What I don't like about the shoes is that they're already starting to shoe signs of wear after one 3 mile hike at a pinch point where the ball of your foot flexes near the toe box. Hopefully its just a cosmetic issue, but I'm a little skeptical.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D.

customer_reviews.title: Tie them tight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a size that exactly matches my foot dimensions (as measured by the Snapfeet app). At first these hurt the second/long/pointer/index toe on my right foot, but that seems to have been caused by tying a bit loose. I'd done this with the intention that it would increase ankle freedom, but I was wrong. Tying as tight as I could resolved all issues. Awesome shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WORKOUT SHOES!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of merrell's for a long time, using usually their trail shoes and i gave in to try a new pair, and oh boy was i was surprised I love this shoe, i hit the gym and run every day perfect for running yet perfect for circuits/workouts in the gym. YOUR DAMN RIGHT IM GONNA ORDER A SECOND PAIR! HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! GREAT SHOES!! I've had the them for two months and THEY STAND STRONG STILL, GREAT DESIGN AND DURABLE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not really barefoot...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure for those who wear normal shoes, these might feel barefoot but they are far from it. They have a rather thick and cushiony insole that has very defined arch support. Very uncomfortable for me and definitely not barefoot feeling. Returning after just trying them on so I can't say much about durability.
customer_reviews.author: Kiyoshi

customer_reviews.title: Great "barefoot" shoe but need to size up
customer_reviews.text: A friend who is a Marine colonel who runs 5-6 miles every day swears by these shoes so I gave them a try. I've only worn these on a couple of runs by so far, so good. I wear a size 13 dress shoe but typically wear a 14 for running shoes. In this case, the 14 was too small and I had to send it back for a 15, which fits well. That's a bit odd, since my size 13 Merrell hiking boots fit just fine. It turned out to be a bonus, in that the 15s were considerably cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Joyner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Let's begin with the fact that I have abused these shoes. I went trail running doing climbs of over 4000ft. These shoes went through snow, mud, sand, rocks, and solid trail. They have hit branches, sharp rocks, spikes, and more. The shoes held amazing with only a mild cut in them and barely any damage to the tread. If I could I would buy another pair just for the sake of having another one. These are super comfy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Siri

customer_reviews.title: Long-lasting foot-shaped minimalist running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these when they first came out and they lasted several years. I was happy to find they are still made and are still the same shoe. I have some foot issues that don't allow me to run long in these, but I wear them a lot; they help remind me how to run as if I were barefoot. They are great for hikes though, for me. I person with a more perfect foot should find them great for minimalist running.
customer_reviews.author: John Beckwith in o

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, but runs big
customer_reviews.text: I have been an avid new balance minimalist wearer, but the cost of them keeps rising. I decided to give these a try since they have the vibram sole. They are very comparable, however they do run a little large. I got a 9.5 as that is what was recommended based on the sizing chart, however I believe a 9 would be a better fit. If I haven't been playing the return game so much already to try out new shoes I would have exchanged them. I will buy again if they hold up well, but will be going a half size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: felicia-o

customer_reviews.title: Yup!
customer_reviews.text: Just returned the New Balance v7's. They just didn't fit as well out of the box, or even after a couple miles, as previous versions. Read every review out there and I've always loved my Merrell hiking boots so decided to give these a try....yup, trail glove is a perfect description. They already fit like a new golf glove, just perfect....best out of the box feel I've ever had!
customer_reviews.author: sean stultz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe
customer_reviews.text: The Trail Glove 4's are an awesome pair of shoes! I bought the Trail Glove 3's awhile back. My old pair was worn, and I was going to buy the Trail Glove 5, but read reviews that said they changed up the entire shoe. I'm so glad I purchased a couple pairs of the Trail Glove 4. Great shoe, fits perfect, and wearable everywhere, even when you're not training. I would recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Schipper

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 16 sneaker (Asics), size 14 dress shoe/boot. As well... I'm 300lbs. I used to wear the vibram toe shoes, but it attracted too much attention. I got the size 15... it was the biggest they had, and I figured... worst case I ship it back. LOVE LOVE LOVE. I quickly bought another pair. One for in the house, the other for out of the house and running. They are a little snug on my foot, width wise, which was to be expected. But that went away with a little wearing. Love love love
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great all round shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. These are fantastic for a permanent traveller. They squash down to nothing in a bag. I got these after having the Saucony Peregrine 5 which for me had too much soft cushioning which made me feel unbalanced especially on trail runs. These have just the right amount of cushioning for me where trail runs on uneven ground feels balanced and controlled, and yet they have just enough cushioning for me to be comfortable on longer general walks or hikes. I use these for the gym, travelling from A to B, running, hiking and a bit of trail running here and there. They look great too. Just perfect for my use case.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: These are a very light weight shoe with very little support or cushion. They provide an almost barefoot experience but with enough protection from rocks and other trail obstacles. I got them for scrambling around in rocky terrain and they are perfect. Lots of traction and foot protection, but not too cumbersome and have enough 'Feel' that you know what your foot is doing at all times. This is what I was looking for and they are excellent for the purpose for which they were purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I've tried to find something I like as well and haven't yet. Decided to go with something I know is comfortable and light in weight. The quality of the product is without peer. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best Barefoot Shoes Ever
customer_reviews.text: I've thus far purchased 3 pairs of shoes based on the Trail Glove 4 footbed. And I love them all. This is the most comfortable barefoot/minimalist shoe I've ever worn. Well, I don't have huge experience with barefoot shoes... but these are awesome. Super comfy. I don't really run in these, I have a set of ON that I use for beating up the pavement, but these are awesome at work and picking up and putting down heavy lumps of metal.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miley

customer_reviews.title: Trail Glove 4 is a great addition to my Vapor Glove 4
customer_reviews.text: For the last two years, I have been working out with the Vapor Glove 3 and now the VG4. The VG4 was a marked improvement over the 3. As running has been increasing in my workouts, I wanted to have a little more cushion but not too much so I tried the Trail Gloves based on great reviews. Because there were so many negative arch support reviews for the Trail Glove 5, I tried it and and TG 4. I agree with all of the negative reviews for the TG 5 and am super happy with my new TG4s. They have just enough support under the ball of my foot without going overboard. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Wad Osbourne

customer_reviews.title: Not the best value given quality concerns
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit and comfort. Wish they had held up better. After just a few times wearing them on walks, both shoes began showing signs of abrasion near the top of the shoes in line with the ball of each foot where nothing had been rubbing or scraping. I would like to buy them again, but will wait for a sale because I feel like they are overpriced for the quality. I feel like I could get equal or better quality and wear-resistance from a $30 pair of shoes from a discount store.
customer_reviews.author: Lowflyer

customer_reviews.title: Hot and not breathable makes for smelly feet.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these shoes, but they are hot and they don't breathe. As a result, they make my feet stink (they don't normally, I promise!). The build quality is great, I really like the fancy tongue design, but because I love my wife, I can't inflict smelly feet on her every time I go for a walk. I tried baking soda and Fabreeze, but nothing really helps. I didn't have a problem like this with, which I had before these, but fell apart fairly quickly as an everyday shoe.
customer_reviews.author: I. Roddis

customer_reviews.title: Merrell back to form!
customer_reviews.text: I loved my first Merrell shoe, Road Glove 2, but the second one I got, Vapor Glove 2, was just awfully made. It was a terrible product and fell apart in a couple months. But the Trail Glove 4 is a fantastic return to form! It's stronger and lasting longer while still zero drop and comfortable. I love wearing as both a running shoe and an every day shoe.
customer_reviews.author: FrancisF

customer_reviews.title: Great All Terrain Shoe, but not durable
customer_reviews.text: These are my all time favorite pair of shoes. My only concern is that they can be quite slippery on flat wet surfaces, but I believe this is due to the hardness of the rubber (softer rubber would of course wear out faster). I wear these everywhere from downtown to the backwoods. However: After owning these for a few months I have at least 3 tears in the shoes. These shoes are not durable enough to endure the harsh conditions. They are still functional, but no longer pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff-M

customer_reviews.title: Best trail glove yet
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the trail glove 2, 3, and now 4, and are all excellent shoes. The updates to the 4 are quote welcome though, making it a much better shoe. It has the same barefoot running feel and thin sole, but the new body of the shoe is way more comfortable. There's no seems from the tongue rubbing against your feet, it feels far more like a sock than a shoe. The only negative I can see is that the laces are a bit thin, don't know how long they will hold out or how a thicker lace will feel if swapped in. I don't mind them though.
customer_reviews.author: Tedd

customer_reviews.title: The MOST comfortable shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This Trail Glove shoe is VERY VERY comfortable. It does fit like a glove for your foot. Extremely light weight. I've not ran in these shoes nor do I really plan on it. But for just everyday walking and light hiking, these are fantastic! Fair warning though...on certain terrain you will feel more than others. The sole is thin so dread lightly over gravel.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Staehlin

customer_reviews.title: Awful, lasting smell
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are comfortable and fit well. But, after wearing them two days in a row without socks, they stink terribly, and now make socks and feet stink after wearing them only for a short time. I have tried several things from airing them out to using shoe deodorant with no success. I'm traveling in Europe and I'm stuck with these shoes for now. This is very unpleasant. For years, I have been wearing shoes without socks, but I have never experienced such a terrible and lasting smell with any of my shoes. For shoes that can be worn without socks, this is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: thekiwis

customer_reviews.title: First shoe to ever tear up my knee
customer_reviews.text: Not only do these shoes lack arch support, they tilt the inner foot down and the outer foot up. This compounds up the leg to the knee to create knee pain and issues. Merell is using the precept of allowing natural gait to sell their shoe when in fact this shoe interferes with natural gait and weight distribution. $80 pair of shoes in the trash. Never again Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Now my go to shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these, but be careful where you step! There's definitely a learning curve after wearing thick soles and work boots for many years. I've really been trying to change my step pattern from ball first to pad first and on the days I nail it, my joints feel so much better. I do question the longevity of these as there's not much to them, but I realize that's the type of shoe I purchased too. The toe box is a bit loose on me, but that's likely just my feet.
customer_reviews.author: James Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Over 300Km on
customer_reviews.text: This is the best minimalist shoes that I've used. Enough protection to run of rough pavement, but still light weight. The shoe laces are too stretch for my tastes, but not significate enough to remove a star. Signs of wear on my running impact points started showing up around 280Km. No signs of material detachement (common on minimals shoes).
customer_reviews.author: E.S.A.

customer_reviews.title: cheap making but light-weight
customer_reviews.text: Update: After three months of daily use, the shoes start to fall apart. The textile mesh is ripping where the shoes fold during walking. Too expensive for one season... Cannot recommend. In theory (see above) a compromise between the pure barefoot shoes without any sole and regular shoes: While the shoe is a barefoot one, it's outdoor profile makes it a bit more sturdy & shock-absorbing. Great for barefoot beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Christian R.

customer_reviews.title: Laced with frustration!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes deserve a 5. I almost gave them a 2. Settled on 4. Here’s why: The laces are far TOO LONG and are very difficult to keep tied. I am forever stepping on them when I run or fast-walk and it happens all the time! I’ve had them a year and have used them every day. The laces drive me NUTS! They get caught in the crank of my bike and I have to constantly find creative tricks to keep them tied and tucked out of the way. Great shoes but the laces really take the edge off of my wearing enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: King Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Did not last more than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Very good shape, ultra comfortable, good design, but I use it for work. I am a Nurse so I use these shoes 4 days a week, 10 hours, to walk on a Hospital floor. After 3 months, they are broken. Too expensive for just 3 months. Shoes are very comfortable but they have a durability issue. The mesh fabric at the flex point on the sides is starting to thin and to separate. Not worth for the price
customer_reviews.author: Tony Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Been using the trail gloves since version 2. This one works pretty well and has enough sole so that I don't poke myself on rocks, but little enough to have the barefoot experience
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the most comfortable pair of shoes I have owned
customer_reviews.text: It took me a couple days, I love these shoes. They are light and breathable. Every other pair of shoes I own require a special sole insert to be comfortable. Not these. It did take me a couple days to get used to them. Actually hurt my feet at first. There are instructions about how this is to be expected because it is "barefoot" style. Only downsides are the too-large Merrell text on the shoe and the top fabric is easily scratched. I would still recommend them though. For my feet, they are great.
customer_reviews.author: A Olson

customer_reviews.title: Tearing tongue after first use
customer_reviews.text: If I could give zero stars, I would. I bought Merrell’s because of their reputation for quality but I am extremely disappointed in these shoes. I have worn these shoes only once and the elastic band holding the tongue has already started tearing. I’m returning these. I’m really confused as to how this shoe could possibly endure what it was made to do like cross-country training as I have only walked in them to break them in. This is inexcusable.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my first pair after developing plantar fasciitis in my right foot. I read some research papers that showed a zero heel lift shoe provided benefit. Sure enough, these shoes help my plantar fasciitis melt away. I've hiked hundreds of miles in these shoes and decided to buy this second pair just in case their production stopped. So these are my second pair. Is there a higher rating than a repurchase?
customer_reviews.author: MChase

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the roomy toe box, slightly thicker sole and more aggressive tread than vapor 3. Unfortunately the arch support is brutal and still sore 24 hours later after a few hours of wearing these around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 123456

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, I've had Merrell's barefoot line for almost 10 years and I ran those shoes so many miles and now that I've finally had to replace I'm thrilled with the modifications between that shoe and this one. The vibram soles are amazing. I love the design. They fit exactly as described. Great pair of shoes, keep up the good work merell and thank you seller for maintaining and quickly shipping this great pair of shoes
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shoe....hot spots if not fitted right.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes, comfy and for from the start. I of course tried them on at a local store before buying. They are narrower that the past models, tighter heel. I had to order a half size up to get my fat foot comfortable. Cons: 1-mid heel inseam can create pressure if not the correct size. 2-The elastic band that holds the tongue folds and rubs on your foot, creating a hot spot on the outer foot /ball. This saddens me as these shoes are nice and light, but hurt my foot on a 3 mile run last night.
customer_reviews.author: Shadows

customer_reviews.title: A nice compromise for the winter months
customer_reviews.text: I wear toe shoes year round. The problem is that toe shoes are not water proof or even resistant. These are nice to bike to work with and walk outs side in in the winter instead of wearing heavy boots every where. They are a little stiff to say they give you the barefoot experience but it is an acceptable middle ground for someone who hates a standard shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Weber

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great! I wear 11 (US) but in Merrell I always wear 11.5 just a heads up. These shoes are super light weight. The soles move very well. The material is very plyable. The tung is attached to the I side of the shoe so they wrap your foot for a great fit. The laces are kinda streatchy whitch is great because I don't tie my shoes traditionally (I tie them loose and slip them on). The look great!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine May

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like a minimal shoe and this fits the bill. I don't like shoes with a lot of support or cushion. I've been wearing minimal shoes for about eight years now and it works for me. This is my second pair of Merrel shoes, and I will continue to buy them as long as they make a minimal shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: Slim and Lightweight and Great Treads
customer_reviews.text: These shows are wicked comfortable and sturdy and that vibram sole really grabs on pavement and trails. The cut is nice and I really appreciate how slim they are. I am not sure why some sneakers/shoes are so poofy. Style I guess? The end where your toes go is less pointy than most shoes (I say this because I did not notice and that may be a deal breaker for some.) The interior wraps over your foot instead of the laces tightening two separate sides as in other shoes which makes them feel much more secure. I look forward to wearing these out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilfred Jr

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoes of all time
customer_reviews.text: I now have two pairs in different colors. I live in the sunbelt, so I wear them without socks in the summer and with socks in the winter. Great casual shoes for the outdoors and indoors, and they can get wet with no problem at all. That includes river wading. Really comfortable! My favorite shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Louis L.

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing Trail Gloves for years and have always been a fan, but this particular model took a wrong turn. The material they decided to change to for the majority of the shoe is very poor quality. It looks alright at first, but does not hold up well at all and just starts fraying and falling apart. This newer pair of shoes didn’t tale too long to look worse than the old pair I was trying to replace. Thankfully Merrell seems to have realized this, because the newest model has already switched back to the original fabric design. I’d forgo buying this model and go for either the previous or current model.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoe for multiple terrains
customer_reviews.text: I use this shoe to go on jogs of roughly 2-4 miles, primarily on sidewalk. I know these are trail shoes but I don’t like having any heel drop on my shoes when I jog and these do the trick. I like the way the tongue is stitched in the shoe, which prevents it from wiggling around. Stitching and sole appears to be high quality. The traction on dirt is excellent. Note that its not great on wet sidewalk, though probably not worse than most soles.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: best shoes
customer_reviews.text: this is my second pair of these and 3rd from merrell, had a previous model of this shoe before, still have them but the sole is worn out after 3 years great fit, feels like glove on your foot, very comfortable , taking a bit of getting used to having no rise in sole but that only takes a couple of days
customer_reviews.author: Be prepared

customer_reviews.title: Not the best not the worst running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I liked these shoes before they changed the design. I went back to ASICS Gel Kayano because of the change. For minimal running shoes the Merrel shoes were good, but I have wide and flat feet and dealt with blisters after five or more miles running. Great for easy day hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Seth M Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have the Glove 3 and really like them for Crossfit, lifting, and short burst running but I absolutely love the Glove 4. It fits a little tighter in the box and forefoot and has a little more general support than the Glove 3 and the sole seems just a touch thicker. No loss in what you want in a minimalist shoe though. I will wear these to run longer distances than 1 mile and wear them for daily wear. Likely get another pair for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: David Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing negative to say about these shoes. I had a pair they discontinued years ago andni was crazy sad about that, however sad I was in now very happy I found these on sale! They got very well, and have minimal tread giving you excellent contact with ground allowing for a more natural feel.
customer_reviews.author: Nigarachi3742

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe. A lot. Tired of a slipping tongue that allowed pro or supenation,the design on this shoe was what I wanted. I didn’t want too much arch support or too thick a sole, I wanted a shoe that allowed my strides to feel more natural while also allowing my body to move more naturally. This shoe does just that. From heel strike to push off this shoe has it. Ultra light, simple support, and its comfortable. This shoe does it’s job so you can focus on what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy.Bohrer

customer_reviews.title: the most comfortable of all the pairs I have had
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Merrell shoes for training and for walking on a treadmill for a number of years. These are the lightest, and in many ways, the most comfortable of all the pairs I have had. The only thing I do not like is that there is no tongue as one would expect to find in a conventional lace up shoe. Instead, of a conventional tongue, the upper part of the shoe wraps around your foot from the inside and laces under the opposite side. I did not realize this when I ordered these. Otherwise, they are great for both working with my trainer and walking.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Howard Shealy

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, perfect style. I’m ready to put on the miles!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is WOW! Slipped these on as soon as they arrived and truly fit like a custom-fitted glove. There is so much more support than my other brand of minimalist runners I’ve been wearing in recent years. Haven’t been to a run or workout yet in them, but have been breaking them in and can’t imagine an issue. Color and style is great, too. (I ordered men’s because the color and style options were way closer to what I like. So tired of “girl” shoes!) My only complaint is the elastic-y shoes strings. I find them too thin and annoying, and doubt they will hold up long. Otherwise, I think I have a new fav shoe!
customer_reviews.author: PBrown

customer_reviews.title: Incredible shoe! Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: First time trying Merrell’s and they do not disappoint!! Super comfortable the second you put them on. Amazing for all my cross training needs, and I really enjoyed trail running in them as well. I would recommend this shoe to anyone that participates in any kind of physical training, whether it’s HIT, running stairs, or lifting weights. This shoe is amazing. I’ve only had it a week so let’s see how it holds up over time
customer_reviews.author: K^2

customer_reviews.title: New favorite shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered same size as my Trail Glove 3s, and fit was great. Design on these is wayyyy better then the 3. The lace eyelets on the 3 were pretty poorly designed, and the laces were always too short. These are much more comfortable and look so much better. Interested to see how well they hold up! 100% my favorite shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Go a Half Size Up
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality and durability of the product is excellent. However, the toe box is not as generous as I thought. Reading the reviews lead me to believe that the their standard shoes size would fit more like a shoe labeled as wide in the same size. Unfortunately, after walking for 10 minutes, I feel the outermost perimeter of my toe box feels slightly pinched. This caused my feet to feel tight and restricted. If you have been using a competitors shoe in a wide and want to buy this shoe, I would recommend going a half size up. Which is a shame because the length of the shoe is perfect for my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable shoes not built to last.
customer_reviews.text: The Vibram soles will outlive the rest of the shoe, whatever the material is that they're made of will wear out far too quick. They're great shoes until they start forming a crease behind where your toes bend when your run/walk that eventually fray & start tearing. I've moved over to the vapor glove cotton & I'm positive that will alleviate this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Jon

customer_reviews.title: A Comfortable Shoe, but Doesn’t Compare to Old Styles
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these shoes. I’ve owned the vapor glove 2s in varying colors and that shoe is my all time favorite shoe. I do pretty much anything in them. So I was really excited to try the vapor glove 4. The shape is much different, I’m unsure of what materials differ, but it feels less malleable than the older models. It also felt like a shoe I’d have to break in, whereas the older vapor gloves felt the same from beginning to end. Ultimately, I ended up returning it and buying the older model.
customer_reviews.author: W. Woche

customer_reviews.title: “Vertical” ones are camouflage colors not grey like the picture. Ugly AF.
customer_reviews.text: Color doesn’t match the picture. I thought I was buying grey shoes but they are more green/camouflage looking than grey. I got the “vertical” ones. Seem fine but I cannot wear them to work now due to looking like a moron with camouflage shoes.
customer_reviews.author: mike mccurry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfect. Got them and hiked 22 miles. Never any breaking in. Love the barefoot, wide toe box and your foot gets lots of exercise. Best barefoot shoe - rate way above Xer brand, which I have a couple of pairs. My husband got the same shoe for men. Completely satisfied
customer_reviews.author: C. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I have a hard time getting shoes that fit me properly but these are an exact true to size. They feel wonderful on my feet. Zero slipping, rubbing or discomfort. They literally seem to exercise my feet and it feels great. I feel like these are going to strengthen my feet. The toe box is very roomy but the way these shoes are designed, you can snugg them down lightly on all but your toes. Different strokes for different folks, but for me, these shoes are awesome! Love em.
customer_reviews.author: EKH

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Have always heard about the comfort of MERRELL...these however just so so. And the visible dried glue in spots is bad quality control. 67 pair of shoes and finally added Merrell to my collection and I was underwhelmed to say the least. I like the look, fit a little snug .
customer_reviews.author: dayno1220

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes I’ve bought every color. I wear them everyday, hiking, biking, running, shopping, work, etc. If you’ve never worn “barefoot shoes” before expect sore calves until you get used to it. If you are sore it just shows you how much harm other shoes do to your flexibility/form.
customer_reviews.author: Sploodgemuffin

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, comfortable to run in.
customer_reviews.text: Fits awesome. The wrap design of the shoe allows you to make it snug or loose as necessary. Way better than the garbage Nike Free's I've been wearing for the last few years. I should mention I normally wear either 10.5 wide or 11 normal. I've run about 20+ miles in these now and I'm super happy, no blisters or discomfort related to the shoe. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice style, not durable fabric
customer_reviews.text: The Trail Glove 4 is not nearly as durable as their predecessor. I've bought Trail Glove 3 Runners annually for three years in a row and wore them every day for work and jogging until the soles began to wear. I could not have been happier, in fact, I still have them all for mowing, painting, working in a big box store. I really liked the style change in the Trail Glove 4 and also wore them every day for last 7 months. I looked down yesterday to find the fabric wearing away at the toe box. Very disappointed. The material has to change before I will buy a Trail Glove again.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Merrill's are the Best
customer_reviews.text: Well this is my 4th pair of Merrill's. I am kind of upset that it took me so long to find these shoes. I will never buy another brand. These fit like a glove. People have commented that they look like they were made for my feet. The only thing thst I have noticed is that they are not very heavily padded. I bought them for a trip that I'm taking in a couple of weeks so I'll post again after. So far amazing as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Feel great, fit great (I wear an 11 Merrell Moab boot and I followed some of the reviews suggesting ordering a whole size down and they fit perfect). Quality seems right on par as with my other Merrell shoes, excited to break them in!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Gerhart

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfy gym shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Needed some minimalist gym shoes. These are light weight and comfy. I tend to lean towards wider toe box shoes like Keen, but these fit great. Comfortable to squat and and run in. And they match my covid mask, so that's a bonus
customer_reviews.author: Page One Automotive

customer_reviews.title: Different from older versions of the trail glove.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Good traction. The tongue design is different and I have to be a little more careful as I put them on. The toe box is more narrow than past versions but seems to be just wide enough for my average width foot. The sole it a little tougher than previous versions so you don't feel the ground as much but this can be good on very rocky trails.
customer_reviews.author: Joel H

customer_reviews.title: Can’t say enough good things about these
customer_reviews.text: My absolute favorite trail running shoe for rough terrain, otherwise I use VFFs. These are very wearable around town too, as they are a casual looking sneaker. Minimal heal rise, excellent terrain feel. One of my favorites!
customer_reviews.author: meep

customer_reviews.title: BEST DARN SHOE YOU CAN BUY - USE IN THE GYM AS WELL
customer_reviews.text: BEST SHOE I HAVE EVER OWNED. Merrell Company has done their research. I tend to have a slightly wider but no abnormal toe area compared to heel. These shoes and ALL Merrells I have come across have been designed for PEOPLE with FEET. In other words it seems like they have designed shoes where you don't have to scrunch your toes into a point. AND all their shoes fit well and are ready to wear. Never have I had to break them in. My concern was that the "mesh" on top would rub while being in the straps on the row and bike machine at the gym. SO FAR they work well with no rub or damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe for Trail Races
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this shoe for a Spartan Super and a Tougher Mudder. They are holding up really well, even after I have put them through the wash over 10 times. For reference I wear a 11.5 in Saucony running shoes, but I had to size down to a 10.5 in these.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but feel GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, pricey - but who else hates paying say...75.00 or 80.00 instead of 99.00 for shoes, that feel ok but ehhhh, not really gonna make you happy? These feel really great, perfect fit, enough give, enough support, and very nice product. This is my first pair of zero whatever they call it shoes with no heel, etc. Very very nice. Kudos to Merrill again for putting out a vetted, tested, high quality product. I trust this co. right now for high QA.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Best minimalist shoe I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap the minimalist shoe technology is so good these days. I've been using minimalist shoes for 5 years or so. These are, by far, the best minimalist shoes I've ever worn. It's the best of both worlds. No heel drop and no squished toes, but with great traction and impressive shock absorption. And only $100. Are you kidding me? I paid $175 for my last pair and they weren't this good.
customer_reviews.author: Rob L

customer_reviews.title: Something is wrong with these shoes. Don't buy them.
customer_reviews.text: I am returning to amend my previous review. After a couple months of use, the soles of these shoes blistered away, and popped. I gave a 2 star at the time, as they were comfortable, but I was disappointed by the quality (I've been wearing Merrell Vapor Gloves and Trail Gloves almost exclusively since 2011 and never experienced this problem). Merrell was great, and promptly replaced the shoes - somehow I actually received two pairs of replacement shoes... great! EXCEPT: both pairs of replacement shoes have also had the sole blister away from the shoe. That's 3 pairs all with the same problem. Something is seriously wrong with the glue used in these shoes. Don't buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Jalen Hoehn

customer_reviews.title: Not good for slipper or damp hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: I should have sent these back. They are very slippery on any damp or hard surface which you encounter on rocky trails. Also, the elastic strap that runs down the side of the shoe to hold the tongue in, rolls every time I put the shoe on. Very disappointed but I am going to wear them out to get my moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: Skips Warren

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, vegan-friendly shoe that hits more muscles
customer_reviews.text: I actually didn't realize this was a "glove"/barefoot style shoe when I ordered it, I only know I liked the brand and the shoe looked cool. Wearing this shoe has helped me develop more muscles that I don't normally use, like around my shin. It's a unique experience compared to platform-style shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Narrow
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made shoe. I have been buying Merrell shoes through Amazon for several years, and will continue to do so. I wear a 10 but order a 10 1/2 to get the width I need. This particular model seems narrower than all others.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Bonnet

customer_reviews.title: goofy looking
customer_reviews.text: There are mostly good things about these shoes, they fit good, if you are a skinny guy, then they are fine. if you are heavy like myself, 220lbs, then these don't work. Not enough support, plus they just look goofy on your feet. I really liked a few things about them and wished there was something on the market with more support for a big guy. The sock and fit was great.
customer_reviews.author: jimidhendrix

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, own two pairs
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe, fits like a glove. easy to slip on and off. only negative I have has to do with my pants length. due to the low profile style, most of my jeans end up being just a tad to long with shoes. Has not stopped me from wearing shoes or ordering a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Big Steve Stomper

customer_reviews.title: Good fit but will they last?
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd pair of TGs and I really like them. Comfortable and good on light trails, walking, or running. However, sole split after just a couple weeks and the laces look worn and frayed already too (had these about 3 months). Fit is great but durability seems questionable.
customer_reviews.author: KR

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Trail Glove 4 Runner
feature_bullets: Breathable mesh lining, Vibram TC5 outsole
Stack heel or toe height is 0.45 inch. Trail protect pad offers underfoot protection
